chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas B Lorentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must obtain employment. If unemployed or underemployed, must seek work.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.   Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 30 days jail with work release. The jail time may be served by  240 hours of community service work to be completed within the first year of probation.   If the defendant fails to perform the community service as ordered he/she must report to the jail as ordered with credit of 1 day of jail served for each 8 hours of community service completed.

30 days jail with work release. The jail time may be served by  240 hours of community service work to be completed within the first year of probation.   If the defendant fails to perform the community service as ordered he/she must report to the jail as ordered with credit of 1 day of jail served for each 8 hours of community service completed.

supervisions.notes: In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.
Court grants good time and Huber. Court grants 2 days credit. Sentence may be served in Chippewa County if at no cost to Barron County. Must report to jail today.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas B Lorentz in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Olson makes corrections to PSI.  Attorney Olson files a letter and proof of reinstatement.  1:44 Defendant's mother addresses the court 1:48 Argument by State 1:53 Argument by Attorney Olson 2:03 Defendant relates 2:06 Court questions Defendant 2:12 Court relates and orders:

Count 1:
SW - 2 years Probation
Must follow through with any treatment recommended by Probation Agent.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must obtain employment.  If unemployed, must seek work.
30 days jail with work release.  The jail time may be served by 240 hours of community service work to be completed within first year of Probation.  If the defendant fails to perform the community service as ordered he/she must report to the jail as ordered with credit of 1 day of jail served for each 8 hours of community service completed.
Court costs including DNA surcharge.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.  

Count 2:
30 days jail - Huber and good time granted - Credit for 2 days - Sentence may be served in Chippewa County if at no cost to Barron County - Must report to jail today 
Court costs including DNA surcharge - 60 DTP
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Voting rights and firearm warning given.

Jail Faxed

Defendant Lucas B Lorentz in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates re: defendants certified driving record.  A copy was given to Attorney Olson today.  Defense objects to the driving record going to the jury.  Parties agree the cover sheet can go to the jury.  Defense requests the media cart for cross and State request the media cart for her opening.  

Sharon M., Clerk
8:33 20 jurors seated.  8:35 All jurors sworn.  Court voir dire.  9:01 State voir dire.   9:02 Defense voir dire.  9:08 Peremptory strikes made.  Court gives opening jury instructions. 9:18 Jury sworn.  9:19 Jury excused.  No objection by State or Defense as to the jury selected.  No motions.  9:21 Court recesses.

9:52  Court resumes and court will need to voir dire that juror. Attorney Olson questions the juror.  State relates and does not object.  Attorney Olson requests that juror be struck.   Court does not strike that juror and will keep her on the panel.
10:07  Jurors enter - 10:08  State gives opening statement - 10:16 Defense Attorney Olson gives opening statement;   10:18  Sgt  Matthew Bach with RLPD called, sworn and direct by the state.  Witness identified the defendant.  PL Exh #1 Defendants certified driving record -  10:31 cross by Defense.  DE Exh #2  Video; offered and received.  10:40  Jurors exit.  Courts discussion to state's objection.  Court sustains the objection. 10:43  Jurors return and cross continues.  10:45  Jurors exit.  Attorney Olson requests to make a record. Court sustains the objection; 10:50 Jurors return and cross continues.   10:54  Re-direct by State.  10:55 Correctional officer Jeff White with BNSO called, sworn and direct by state.  Witness identified the defendant.  10:59  cross by Attorney Olson.  11:00 Re-direct by State;  11:01  Investigator Chad Thompson with RLPD called, sworn and direct by state.  PL Exh #3   Transmittal form to Crime Lab dated  11-24-2015.  PL Exh #4 package sent to crime lab ; offered and received    PL Exh #5 Transmittal sent to crime lab ; offered and received    PL Exh #6  package sent to crime lab ; offered and received    PL Exh #7 package sent to crime lab ; offered and received  11:09  cross by Attorney Olson. 11:14  Katie Hoffmeyer Analyst with WI State crime lab called, sworn and direct by state.  PL Exh #8  Lab Report;  PL Exh #9 Corrected Lab Report;   Exh 4 is opened and shown to the jurors on the projector screen; Exh 6 is opened and shown to the jurors on the projector screen.  Exh 7 is opened and shown to the jurors on the projector screen.  11:29  cross by Attorney Olson 11:34  Re-direct by the State.  11:36  Jurors exit for Attorney Olson's objection;  11:43  Jurors enter and cross continues.  11:44 Re-direct by the state. 11:45  Re-cross by Attorney Olson.  11:46  Jurors exit for lunch.
30 minute break for lunch.  12:23  Court resumes;  Colloquey given to defendant as he does not wish to testify.    The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Jury Instructions discussed.  Cautionary instructions discussed.  1:24 Jurors return;  State & Defense rests.  Jury Instructions given to the jurors. 1:39  State gives closing argument; 1:43  Defense gives closing argument.  State gives rebuttal.  Final Jury instructions given.  2:01  Oath given to Bailiff.  No objections given re: the reading of the instructions.
2:22  On the record,  Note from jurors with Judges responses given.
3:08  Jurors enter with a vercdict.   
Jurors find on
 Count 1 -  Guilty
 Count 2 -  Guilty
State moves to accept the verdict
Defense moves to set aside the verdict.

Court enters judgment of count 1 & count 2

State moves to Revoke bond.
Defense moves to have  bond remain.
Court agrees for the bond to remain. 

 PSI ordered  -  Must report by December 23, 2016.  

 Bond conditions to continue.

 Voter and firearm restrictions are in place.

Court relates regarding Jury Instruction regarding other acts.

Defendant Lucas B Lorentz in court with attorney Aaron Olson.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court relates, makes findings - there is a reasonable suspicion that Mr. Lorenz was driving a vehicle with an excessively loud muffler and the stop was appropriate and seizure of the wallet was appropriate and the search was lawful.  Court denies motion to suppress unlawful stop & unlawful search.  Attorney Olson to prepare Order denying the motion to suppress.  Attorney Olson makes speedy trial request.
